blocked_html_body.message: This site was blocked by the Linkumori (Clean URLS) Add-on, because we identify this site as an advertising and/or tracking service. To visit this site, you must temporarily deactivate the Add-on or disable domain blocking in the Linkumori (Clean URLS) settings. After this you can click on the button below to load the page.

blocked_html_button.description: This string is used as button on the blocked site page.

blocked_html_title.message: This site was blocked by Linkumori (Clean URLS)
blocked_html_title.description: This string is used as title on the blocked site page.

built_in_rules_enabled_description.message: Use the bundled Linkumori/ClearURLs rules. Disable this to run with remote rules and/or custom rules only.
built_in_rules_enabled_description.description: Description for the toggle that controls bundled built-in rules

bundled_rules_description.message: Linkumori uses bundled rules and custom rules to identify and remove tracking parameters from URLs. These rules are automatically updated to ensure effective protection against the latest tracking methods.

error_loading_data.message: Failed to load log data. Please refresh the page.

error_rendering_table.description: Error message when table fails to render

fallback_rules_loaded.message: concerning bundled rule may have been corrupted or not loaded properly. Fallback rules have been loaded instead.

faq_common_mistakes.message: What are common mistakes to avoid?

faq_complete_provider_explanation.message: When set to true, completeProvider marks matching requests for blocking. Actual blocking happens only when the global "Domain Blocking" setting is enabled. When false, you can use normal rules, exceptions, and redirections.

faq_complete_provider_usage.message: Most custom rules should set this to false and use specific parameter removal rules instead.

faq_complete_provider_warning.message: If Domain Blocking is enabled, this can block full access for matching URLs.

faq_complex_example.message: Show me a complex provider example

faq_complex_example_explanation.message: This provider removes tracking parameters and fragments, handles redirects, but protects API, login, and checkout pages from modification.

faq_complex_example_intro.message: Here's an advanced provider with redirections and exceptions:

faq_custom_rules_note.message: Custom rules run together with built-in rules and can override imported bundled/remote provider entries by name.

faq_default_note.description: Label for default behavior notes in FAQ

faq_domain_exceptions_explanation.message: Domain Exceptions work like regular exceptions but use the simpler domain pattern format instead of regex. They allow you to exclude specific domains or subdomains from processing.

faq_domain_exceptions_tip.message: Domain exceptions use the same patterns as Domain Patterns but simpler than regex exceptions.

faq_domain_pattern_adblock.message: ||example.com^ - Hostname match for example.com and its subdomains
faq_domain_pattern_adblock.description: FAQ explanation of AdBlock domain pattern

faq_domain_pattern_adblock_wildcard.message: ||*.example.com^ - Hostname wildcard; each * matches one label (dot segment)
faq_domain_pattern_adblock_wildcard.description: FAQ explanation of AdBlock wildcard pattern

faq_domain_pattern_basic.message: example.com - Simple substring match on full URL (can also match inside longer hostnames/paths)
faq_domain_pattern_basic.description: FAQ explanation of basic domain pattern

faq_domain_pattern_full_wildcard.message: ||*.example.*^ - Matches subdomains with wildcard TLDs, including multi-part TLDs (a.example.co.uk)
faq_domain_pattern_full_wildcard.description: FAQ explanation of full wildcard pattern

faq_domain_pattern_tld.message: ||example.*^ - Matches the domain with wildcard TLDs, including multi-part TLDs (example.co.uk, example.gov.in)
faq_domain_pattern_tld.description: FAQ explanation of TLD wildcard domain pattern

faq_domain_pattern_types.description: FAQ section title for domain pattern types

faq_domain_pattern_wildcard.message: *.example.com - Wildcard regex match on full URL, not strict hostname-only matching
faq_domain_pattern_wildcard.description: FAQ explanation of wildcard domain pattern

faq_domain_patterns.description: FAQ question about domain patterns vs URL patterns

faq_domain_patterns_explanation.message: Domain Patterns support simple tokens and AdBlock-style forms. Matching behavior depends on syntax (some forms check hostname, others match against the full URL string):

faq_domain_redirections_example.message: redirect.example.com$redirect=https://target.com will redirect all URLs from redirect.example.com to https://target.com

faq_domain_redirections_explanation.message: Domain Redirections use domain patterns to detect redirect URLs and extract the target destination. They support the special $redirect= syntax for simple redirect mapping.

faq_exceptions_explanation.message: Exceptions are regex patterns that match URLs where no processing should occur. If a URL matches an exception, all other rules are ignored.

faq_exceptions_usage.message: Use exceptions to protect login pages, API endpoints, or other sensitive URLs from being modified.

faq_force_redirection_explanation.message: Some websites manipulate links through JavaScript, preventing normal redirections. forceRedirection writes the URL directly to the browser's main frame.

faq_force_redirection_usage.message: Enable this for websites like Google that use onClick handlers instead of direct href attributes.

faq_force_redirection_warning.message: Only use when normal redirections fail, as this method is more intrusive.

faq_how_providers_work.description: FAQ question about how providers work

faq_http_methods_common.description: FAQ section title for common HTTP methods

faq_http_methods_delete.description: FAQ list item for DELETE method

faq_http_methods_explanation.message: HTTP Methods allow you to apply rules only to specific types of HTTP requests (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, etc.). This gives you control over which request methods trigger your rules.

faq_http_methods_get.description: FAQ list item for GET method

faq_http_methods_head.description: FAQ list item for HEAD method

faq_http_methods_options.description: FAQ list item for OPTIONS method

faq_http_methods_post.message: POST - Form submissions and API calls
faq_http_methods_post.description: FAQ list item for POST method

faq_http_methods_put.description: FAQ list item for PUT method

faq_http_methods_tip.message: Leave empty to apply to all HTTP methods, or specify only the methods you want to target.

faq_import_benefit_quick.message: Quick setup - no need to manually create complex patterns
faq_import_benefit_quick.description: FAQ benefit of quick setup via import

faq_import_benefit_search.message: Search and filter to find exactly what you need

faq_import_benefit_tested.message: Pre-tested rules that are known to work correctly
faq_import_benefit_tested.description: FAQ benefit of tested rules via import

faq_import_benefit_updates.message: Easy to keep rules updated with new providers
faq_import_benefit_updates.description: FAQ benefit of easy updates via import

faq_list_feature_actions.message: Edit, duplicate, or delete providers with single clicks

faq_list_feature_overview.message: Quick overview of all providers with key statistics

faq_list_feature_search.message: Search providers by name to find specific ones quickly

faq_list_feature_stats.message: See rule counts and pattern types at a glance

faq_mistake_broad.message: Making urlPattern too broad (matching unintended sites)
faq_mistake_broad.description: FAQ common mistake about broad patterns

faq_mistake_complete.message: Setting completeProvider to true unless you really want to block the site

faq_mistake_escape.message: Forgetting to escape special regex characters in patterns
faq_mistake_escape.description: FAQ common mistake about escaping regex

faq_mistake_exceptions.message: Not adding exceptions for important functionality
faq_mistake_exceptions.description: FAQ common mistake about missing exceptions

faq_mistake_testing.message: Not testing rules thoroughly before deploying
faq_mistake_testing.description: FAQ common mistake about insufficient testing

faq_note.description: Label for important notes in FAQ

faq_pattern_exclusive_note.message: Both fields can be present in data, but urlPattern takes priority. Domain Patterns are used only when urlPattern is empty. Limitation: matching is pattern-based (not PSL/eTLD-aware), so wildcard TLD patterns may match more broadly than registrable-domain logic.

faq_perf_combine.message: Combine multiple similar patterns into one regex
faq_perf_combine.description: FAQ performance tip about combining patterns

faq_perf_limit.message: Limit the number of providers to what you actually need
faq_perf_limit.description: FAQ performance tip about limiting providers

faq_perf_review.message: Regularly review and clean up unused rules
faq_perf_review.description: FAQ performance tip about regular review

faq_perf_simple.message: Use simple rules instead of complex rawRules when possible
faq_perf_simple.description: FAQ performance tip about simple rules

faq_perf_specific.message: Make urlPattern as specific as possible
faq_perf_specific.description: FAQ performance tip about specific patterns

faq_provider_example.message: For example, a "Google" provider would handle all Google services with rules to remove tracking parameters from search results, YouTube links, etc.

faq_provider_import.message: How do I import providers from rules?
faq_provider_import.description: FAQ question about provider import feature

faq_provider_import_benefits.description: FAQ section title for import benefits

faq_provider_import_explanation.message: The Provider Import feature allows you to quickly add providers from the built-in rule catalog. Click the 'Import from Rules' button to browse and select providers.
faq_provider_import_explanation.description: FAQ explanation of provider import feature

faq_provider_import_tip.message: You can import multiple providers at once by selecting them and clicking Import.

faq_provider_list.message: How do I manage my providers efficiently?
faq_provider_list.description: FAQ question about provider list management

faq_provider_list_explanation.message: The Provider List view gives you a quick overview of all custom providers. You can search, edit, duplicate, or delete providers without opening each one individually.
faq_provider_list_explanation.description: FAQ explanation of provider list feature

faq_provider_list_features.description: FAQ section title for provider list features

faq_provider_list_tip.message: Open the Provider List from the editor toolbar to browse and manage providers.

faq_providers_explanation.message: Providers are logical units that group multiple rules under the same URL pattern. Each provider targets a specific website or service and contains all the rules needed to clean URLs from that source.

faq_raw_rules_explanation.message: Direct regex patterns applied to the entire URL. Use for complex patterns that don't fit the standard parameter format.

faq_raw_rules_title.description: FAQ section title for rawRules explanation

faq_raw_rules_usage.message: Use rawRules for fragments, path segments, or complex parameter patterns.

faq_redirections_explanation.message: Redirections extract the real destination URL from redirect services. The first capture group in the regex becomes the new URL.

faq_redirections_process.message: The captured URL is automatically decoded with decodeURIComponent() and replaces the original URL.

faq_referral_default.message: Referral marketing is disabled by default, so these parameters will be removed unless explicitly allowed by the user.
faq_referral_default.description: FAQ note about referralMarketing default behavior

faq_referral_explanation.message: Referral marketing parameters help content creators earn commissions. These parameters are only removed when the user has disabled referral marketing support in settings.

faq_resource_types_common.description: FAQ section title for common resource types

faq_resource_types_explanation.message: Resource Types allow you to apply rules only to specific types of web requests (images, scripts, main pages, etc.). This gives you fine-grained control over when rules are applied.

faq_resource_types_tip.message: Leave empty to apply to all resource types, or specify only the types you want to target.

faq_rt_imageset.message: imageset - Image sets for responsive images

faq_rt_object_subrequest.message: object_subrequest - Requests made by embedded objects

faq_rt_other.message: other - Other types not covered above

faq_rules_converted.message: Example: "utm_source" matches the key exactly; "utm_.*" matches keys like utm_source and utm_campaign.
faq_rules_converted.description: FAQ examples for rules key matching

faq_rules_explanation.message: Regex patterns matched against each query parameter key and hash fragment key. Use simple names (for exact key matches) or regex for broader matching.

faq_rules_title.description: FAQ section title for rules explanation

faq_rules_vs_raw.message: What's the difference between rules and rawRules?
faq_rules_vs_raw.description: FAQ question about rules vs rawRules

faq_section_advanced.description: FAQ section title for advanced features

faq_section_basics.description: FAQ section title for basic questions

faq_section_new_features.description: FAQ section title for advanced features

faq_section_properties.description: FAQ section title for provider properties

faq_section_tips.description: FAQ section title for tips and best practices

faq_simple_example.message: Show me a simple provider example

faq_simple_example_explanation.message: This removes Facebook click IDs and UTM parameters, but preserves affiliate links if the user allows referral marketing.

faq_simple_example_intro.message: Here's a basic provider that removes tracking parameters from a fictional shopping site:

faq_test_backup.message: Export your rules before making major changes
faq_test_backup.description: FAQ tip about backing up rules

faq_test_exceptions.message: Always add exceptions for critical pages (login, checkout, API)

faq_test_regex.message: Test regex patterns using online tools like regex101.com
faq_test_regex.description: FAQ tip about testing regex patterns

faq_test_reload.message: Use the "Enforce Rules" button to reload changes without restarting the browser

faq_test_small.message: Start with simple rules and gradually add complexity

faq_testing_tips.message: How should I test my custom rules?

faq_title.description: FAQ button text and modal title

faq_url_pattern_explanation.message: The urlPattern is a regular expression that must match every URL that should be affected by the provider's rules. It defines which websites this provider should handle.

faq_url_pattern_structure.message: The typical structure covers: protocol + subdomain + domain + TLD + directories + parameters

faq_url_pattern_tip.message: Use online regex testers to validate your patterns before adding them.

faq_url_patterns_explanation.message: URL Patterns use full regex for precise control over which URLs match:

faq_use_domain_patterns.message: Use Domain Patterns for simpler hostname/path matching without writing full urlPattern regex.
faq_use_domain_patterns.description: FAQ guidance for using domain patterns

faq_use_url_patterns.message: Use URL Patterns for complex matching (specific paths, query parameters, etc.)
faq_use_url_patterns.description: FAQ guidance for using URL patterns

faq_what_is_custom_rules_answer.message: Custom rules allow you to create your own URL cleaning patterns for websites that aren't covered by the built-in rules. They follow the same structure as the main catalog but are managed separately.

faq_when_to_use_patterns.description: FAQ section title for pattern usage guidance

feature1.message: Built-in privacy-focused URL cleaning enabled by default

feature2.message: Custom Rules support for per-provider and per-pattern control

feature3.message: Whitelist support to bypass cleaning for selected domains

feature4.message: Remote rules and Overload Mode for advanced setups

security_modal_final_warning.message: you should reconsider using this feature if you do not fully understand the implications and risks involved.
security_modal_final_warning.description: Final warning message in security modal

security_modal_main_warning.message: This remote rules feature is designed exclusively for advanced users who know what they are doing. If you do not have an idea of what this means, please do not use this feature.
security_modal_main_warning.description: Main warning text explaining the purpose and risks

security_modal_privacy_text.message: If you add a URL to this software for fetching a JSON file and hash file, the extension will connect to your designated URL to fetch the remote rule JSON file or hash file every time this extension is enabled and loaded in your browser. Each time it fetches files based on your defined URL, the server hosting files like the JSON and hash files will receive your IP address as well as general information such as your extension version, browser, and browser version. This data is subject to the privacy policy of the website or web server (where hosted those files) in question.
security_modal_privacy_text.description: Privacy notice explaining data collection policy

security_modal_recommendation.message: Instead use for built-in rules only solution like built-in rules additionally you can create custom rules manually.
security_modal_recommendation.description: Recommendation to use built-in rules instead

security_modal_risk_1.message: Your IP address and browser information will be exposed to the configured servers

security_modal_risk_2.message: If the rule source is compromised, malicious rules could be served to your browser

security_modal_risk_3.message: Hash verification only protects against transmission tampering, not malicious rule sources

security_modal_risk_4.message: If both rule source and hash file of json files are compromised, you have no protection

security_modal_title.description: Title for the security disclaimer modal

welcomeDescription.message: Linkumori removes tracking parameters from URLs by default and gives you advanced controls when needed. Review the features below, then continue to Privacy Policy and License.

disable_gatekeeper_modal_main_warning.description: Main warning text in disable gatekeeper modal

disable_gatekeeper_modal_gatekeeper_expl.message: Gatekeeper is the built-in safety flow that blocks direct remote URL edits until you acknowledge the security warning and complete typed confirmation.
disable_gatekeeper_modal_gatekeeper_expl.description: Explains what gatekeeper means in disable gatekeeper modal

disable_gatekeeper_modal_recommendation.message: Instead use for built-in rules only solution like built-in rules additionally you can create custom rules manually.
disable_gatekeeper_modal_recommendation.description: Recommendation text in disable gatekeeper modal

disable_gatekeeper_modal_privacy_title.description: Privacy section title in disable gatekeeper modal

disable_gatekeeper_modal_privacy_text.message: If you add a URL to this software for fetching a JSON file and hash file, the extension will connect to your designated URL to fetch the remote rule JSON file or hash file every time this extension is enabled and loaded in your browser. Each time it fetches files based on your defined URL, the server hosting files like the JSON and hash files will receive your IP address as well as general information such as your extension version, browser, and browser version. This data is subject to the privacy policy of the website or web server (where hosted those files) in question.
disable_gatekeeper_modal_privacy_text.description: Privacy section body in disable gatekeeper modal

disable_gatekeeper_modal_risks_title.description: Risks section title in disable gatekeeper modal

disable_gatekeeper_modal_risk_1.message: The extension will connect to your designated URL every time the extension is enabled and loaded in your browser.
disable_gatekeeper_modal_risk_1.description: Risk bullet 1 in disable gatekeeper modal

disable_gatekeeper_modal_risk_2.message: The server hosting remote JSON and hash files will receive your IP address.
disable_gatekeeper_modal_risk_2.description: Risk bullet 2 in disable gatekeeper modal

disable_gatekeeper_modal_risk_3.message: The server may also receive your extension version, browser, and browser version.
disable_gatekeeper_modal_risk_3.description: Risk bullet 3 in disable gatekeeper modal

disable_gatekeeper_modal_risk_4.message: That data is subject to the privacy policy of the website or web server hosting those files.
disable_gatekeeper_modal_risk_4.description: Risk bullet 4 in disable gatekeeper modal

disable_gatekeeper_modal_final_warning.message: By disabling Gatekeeper, you increase risk from unsafe or compromised remote rule sources. If you do not understand this feature, do not use it. Use built-in rules and optionally create custom rules manually.
disable_gatekeeper_modal_final_warning.description: Final warning banner text in disable gatekeeper modal

disable_gatekeeper_modal_cancel.description: Cancel button text in disable gatekeeper modal

disable_gatekeeper_modal_continue.description: Continue button text in disable gatekeeper modal

disable_gatekeeper_confirmation_phrase.message: I understand remote rules risk and disable gatekeeper
disable_gatekeeper_confirmation_phrase.description: Exact phrase user must type to confirm disabling gatekeeper

disable_gatekeeper_confirmation_modal_te.message: To disable gatekeeper, type the exact confirmation phrase below.
disable_gatekeeper_confirmation_modal_te.description: Instruction text for gatekeeper-specific confirmation modal

disable_gatekeeper_confirmation_input_la.description: Input label for gatekeeper-specific confirmation modal

disable_gatekeeper_confirmation_final_te.message: This action reduces safeguards for remote rules. Proceed only if you trust your sources.
disable_gatekeeper_confirmation_final_te.description: Final warning text for gatekeeper-specific confirmation modal

remote_urls_template_note_1.message: Replace placeholder values with your real HTTPS URLs, then import this file.

remote_urls_template_note_2.message: Primary contains the main rule/hash URL pair.

remote_urls_template_note_3.message: Additional is optional and supports multiple rule/hash URL pairs.
remote_urls_template_note_3.description: Template export note 3 for remote URL export JSON

remote_urls_template_note_4.message: Add or remove objects in the additional array as needed.
remote_urls_template_note_4.description: Template export note 4 for remote URL export JSON
